title: Atlantic horseshoe crab
summary: The Atlantic horseshoe crab (Limulus polyphemus), also known as the American horseshoe crab, is a species of marine and brackish chelicerate arthropod.[1] Despite their name, horseshoe crabs are more closely related to spiders, ticks, and scorpions than to crabs.[2] It is found in the Gulf of Mexico and along the Atlantic coast of North America.[1] The main area of annual migration is Delaware Bay along the South Jersey Delaware Bayshore.[3]
